meanings.definition: An employee who does all kinds of work.
meanings.sent1: The factotums at the office handle various tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The factotums in the company are skilled at multitasking.
meanings.sent3: The factotums decided to have a race to see who could finish their tasks first.
meanings.sent4: In the busy kitchen, the factotums were the unsung heroes juggling multiple duties.
meanings.sent5: The factotums were like Swiss Army knives, always ready for any job.

meanings.definition: A person who has many different responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: As a parent, you become the factotums of the household, managing various duties.
meanings.sent2: The factotums in the event planning team ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The factotums took turns wearing different hats to symbolize their varied roles.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a factotums, balancing work, school, and family responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The factotums of the project were indispensable, handling a multitude of tasks.

meanings.sent1: The manor employed factotums to attend to the needs of the guests.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, factotums were common in large households.
meanings.sent3: The factotums comically tried to outdo each other in serving the eccentric master.
meanings.sent4: The factotums moved swiftly around the estate, fulfilling every request promptly.
meanings.sent5: The factotums' dedication to their duties as servants was unmatched.
